channel.title: Newbie Help/Question
channel.description:
Hello, KamikazeSoda here.
I need a little bit of help. I can't seem to figure out how to change the starting location of where new player's will spawn.(I used the Search button.) Also if anyone could tell me any Tut's I should look at that would be appreciated.

item.title: Newbie Help/Question
item.dc:creator: @As_Life_Changes As Life Changes
item.description:
@As_Life_Changes wrote:

no problem at all just glad to help

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Help/Question
item.dc:creator: @KamikazeSoda KamikazeSoda
item.description:
@KamikazeSoda wrote:

Okay I did this
// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet
teleportToX = 2662;//3072;
teleportToY = 3302;//3312;

Added the X and Y croords in the right spot but it still doesn’t work.

And thank you As Life Changes.

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Help/Question
item.dc:creator: @As_Life_Changes As Life Changes
item.description:
@As_Life_Changes wrote:

invisible jaw fix

Purpose: To get rid of that nasty whole in your face

Difficulty: 1 depends on what you know

Assumed Knowledge: c&p

Server Base: Pimp should work on all

Classes Modified: player.java

Procedure

Step 1: open up your player java and search for

			[code]playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]);[/code]

you should see
if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {Step 2: scroll down slowly and look for

		// array of 5 bytes defining the colors

Step 3: If there is anything between that and

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else { replace it with

[code] if (!Item.isFullHelm(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && !Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1))
playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard); // Beard
else
playerProps.writeByte(0);
} else {
playerProps.writeWord(-1);
playerProps.writeWord(npcId);

	}[/code]if there is nothing between them just put it under

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Help/Question
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Look closely.

	[b]teleportToX = 3254[/b];//3072;
	[b]teleportToY = 3420[/b];//3312;

It’s not;

	teleportToX = XCOORDS;//YCOORDS;
	teleportToY = 3420;//3312;

It’s;

	teleportToX = XCOORDS;//3072;
	teleportToY = YCOORDS;//3312;

Save Player.Java, then compile. It should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Help/Question
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Go into Player.Java and search for this;

		// initial x and y coordinates of the player

Underneath that you should see something like this;

// initial x and y coordinates of the player heightLevel = 0; // the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet teleportToX = 3254;//3072; teleportToY = 3420;//3312;

Change the coords in there to anything you wan’t…

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Help/Question
item.dc:creator: @As_Life_Changes As Life Changes
item.description:
@As_Life_Changes wrote:

this is very easy search this

// the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet teleportToX = 3035;//3072; teleportToY = 3699;//3312;

it should look like that but this is how it works

teleportToX = XCOORDHERE;//dont worry about these numbers teleportToY = YCOORDHERE;//dont worry about these numbers

`as life changes

Read full topic
